content.text: Welcome to a German birthday party, or 'Geburtstagsparty'. We'll learn how to congratulate the host, mingle with guests, and say goodbye.

data.phrase: Kannst du mir bitte ein Glas geben?
data.meaning: Can you please give me a glass?

data.tip: The 'r' before 't' is almost silent. Focus on the two distinct parts: 'Geburts' and 'tag'.
The 'ü' sound is made by shaping your lips for 'oo' but saying 'ee'. The 'ch' is soft, like in 'Bach'.

content.title: Arriving at the Party
content.setting: You've arrived at your classmate Anna's birthday party. You see her and walk over. Then, you head to the drinks table and meet another guest, Lukas.

conversation_flow.title: Congratulate Anna
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Hallo! Schön, dass du da bist!

conversation_flow.title: Give Anna the gift
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Vielen Dank! Das ist sehr lieb von dir.

conversation_flow.title: Ask the other guest for a glass

content.text: Great start! When meeting new people in a casual setting like this, Germans use the informal 'du' for 'you'.

data.meaning: Where do you know Anna from?

data.phrase: Ich kenne sie aus dem Deutschkurs
data.meaning: I know her from the German course

data.tip: The 'eu' sounds like 'oy' in 'boy'. The 'sch' is a 'sh' sound.

content.title: Joining a Conversation
content.setting: You are still at the drinks table with Lukas, the guest who gave you a glass. Time to introduce yourself.

extract_info.user_name: Extract the user's name from their message

conversation_flow.title: Ask Lukas how he knows Anna
Explain how you know Anna
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Ich kenne sie von der Uni. Und du?

content.text: Excellent! Now, let's learn how to politely exit a conversation and thank the host before you leave the party.

data.phrase: Es war nett, mit dir zu reden
data.meaning: It was nice to talk to you
Thank you very much for the invitation

data.tip: The 'Tsch' sounds like the 'ch' in 'cheese'. The 'ü' is a short, sharp sound.

content.title: Leaving the Party
content.setting: It's time to leave. First, you'll politely end your conversation with Lukas. Then, you'll find Anna to thank her before you go.

conversation_flow.title: Politely end the conversation with Lukas
Find Anna and thank her for the invitation
Say the party was great and say goodbye
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Gern geschehen! Schön, dass du da warst.
